description: Kamshet is an upcoming hill station near Lonavala. Kamshet is famous for Paragliding schools near Pune and tandem paragliding adventure sports. The camping spot is built in a village theme. Our campsite is just 14 km away from the popular paragliding spot Kamshet. Road conditions are good to reach the campground. Apart from that, Dhak bahiri spot is just 2 km and Uksan lake is 1 km away from the campsite. description:
About the Valley of Flowers Trek:
With the verdant beauty of the snowcapped mountains in the backdrop, the green meadows and the white clouds blend to make dreamlike Valley of Flowers trek. Perched at an altitude of 14,400 ft, this trek was a sudden discovery by British traveller Frank Smith in 1931. Step into the bed of flowers while you head out for this one of a kind beautiful trek.
Known as the most beautiful trek in the world with the blue Primula, Valley of Flowers is a must do trek for you.Blessed with the verdant beauty of the meadows, and the exotic flowers this will be trek which will take you through small streams.
Get a chance to witness the vivid flora and fauna of the region like saxifrages, sediams, lilies, poppy,calendula, daisies and brown bear, snow leopard, blue sheep.
Quick Facts:
Altitude: 14,400 ft
Temperature: Day: 12°C - 20°C & Night: 4°C - 10°C
Trekking Distance: 51km
Difficulty Level: Moderate
Itinerary:
• 28th July (Sunday) - Dehradun- Govindghat via Joshimath and Devaprayag ( 7 to 8 hrs )
• 29th July (Monday)- From Govindghat to Ghangaria (Trek 14km/ 4hrs)
• 30th July (Tuesday)- From Ghangaria to Valley Of Flowers and back ( Trek 8km/ 5hrs )
• 31 July (Wed)- From Ghangaria to Hemkund Sahib and back
( Trek 14km / 6hrs )
• 1st August (Thu)- From Ghangaria to Govindghat ( Trek 14km / 4hrs ) ( Day.Visit Badrinath )
• 2nd August (Friday)-Joshimath - Dehradun.
Charges :14000 (Dehradun - Dehradun)
(Extra expenses may shared between participants)
Includes:
> Complete Transportation from Dehradun to Dehradun
> Stay & Food( during the Trek only)
> Bhadrinadh & mana village visit with transportation
> Forest entry and valley of flowers entry charges
> Club fee
> First aid kit
> Guide charges
Excludes:

Food while travelling
Porter or mules charges
Which are not mentioned in Inclusions.

Advance payment to block your seat: You will be in waiting list unless you make the payment. Please make a payment of Rs. 3000 to confirm your seat. We would need this advance to book bus tickets and making other arrangements.
Mode of payment: Bank account
Payment Details: Account Transfer

description: Around 76 km from Bangalore, Narayanagiri hill is one of the lesser known mountain peaks in Karnataka. This peak lies around 20 km from Ramanagara and is nearly 3800ft in height. Home to the temple of Laxmi Narayana which is open only in the weekends, with remains of the fort encircling the mountain can be seen from the peak. A vast number of natural caves can be explored on your way up. The trail takes you from the carved steps on the rock to the thick forest of Jalamangala which hosts a range of small sized creatures. It is advisable to carry your own drinking water as there is no source of drinking water on top of the mountain. Night trekking this hill is one of the most sought after weekend getaways in and around Bangalore, the weather and the sunrise makes the experience more endearing.kanva is a small water reservoir located around 50 kms from Bangalore on the banks of kanva dam. Considered as an ideal location for Corporate team outings, this place will rejuvenate your senses and give you your much deserved getaway. Take a break from your hectic office hours, because come on! Fun is essential. With the perfect combination of food and adventure sports, our outing package offers an amusing cocktail of enjoyable activities just for you.Trek Difficulty: ModerateTrek Distance: 4 kilometers (each way)Tentative ItineraryDay 011:00PM Pick up starts from Marathahalli Day 101:00AM Reach Reach Ramanagar for pit stop04:00AM Reach peak and relax by the bonfire06:30AM Descend at dawn08:00AM Reach base and head towards Campsite08:30AM Have breakfast09:30AM Water Activities like Kayaking & Swimming12:00PM Leave to Bangalore01:00PM Reach BangaloreWhat's IncludedTransportation (from/to Bangalore)Sunrise TrekWater Activities like Kayaking & SwimmingCampfireBreakfastWhat's ExcludedWater BottleSnacksAnything not mentioned in Inclusions.Pickup PointsMarathahalli (11:00 PM) - Kala mandirSilk Board (11:30 PM) - Central silkbord building .(towards BTM)BTM (11:40 PM) - A2B, Udupi Garden Bus stopBanashankari (12:00 AM) - Bus stopRR Nagar (12:15 AM) - Gopalan ArcadeMode Of Transport1 to 12 pax tempo traveller or winger ( 14 seat vehicle)12 to 30 pax mini Bus ( 24 seat or 32 seat vehicle )30 to 50 pax big boss ( 50 seater vehicle)Things To CarryBackpackRain coat/PonchoWater bottlesEnergy foodPersonal medicationSweater/ jackets for the nightExtra clothing (in case you plan to dive in the lake)Sports shoes or trekking shoes in good conditionFlashlight/Torch with extra batteriesTrack pants and cotton TshirtCamera (optional)Note:Your equipments & equipments distributed to be carried by self. Like bags, sticks, etc.As you are exploring nature, don’t expect washrooms near hills. Washrooms only available at hotel, campsite & home stays are multi-sharing basis. (we reach hotel/campsite for breakfast or lunch).Don’t expect electricity & luxury in the camping area.Organiser DetailsFor queries about this event contact the organiser Manoj 9886421211.About Escape2ExploreEscape2Explore Adventures is not just one of Bangalore's leading adventure travel companies, it's a hub for all nature lovers, adventure enthusiasts and those who just need a little escape from the routine of life to explore outdoors. Choose from a wide range of exciting outdoor activities and destinations that best suit your team/group, and leave the arrangements to us.

description: Trek India Welcomes you to the Prabalmachi CampingAbout Prabalmachi CampingWant to spot fireflies just 1-hour drive from Mumbai. So Prabalmachi is your next destination.Prabalmachi Trek is one of the best weekend treks near Mumbai. Your trekking will start from Panvel. At Panvel station, you will be welcomed by our company representative and then transferred to the base village of Thakurwadi.Camping at Prabalmachi is an exciting and fun-filled experience overflowing with unique stories, and unexploited nature, under a blanket of the star-studded sky and in the midst of a forest full of fireflies.Fireflies or lightning bugs are structured with specailized cells in their abdomen which emit light. Behold the glimmering thrill of millions of fireflies through your naked eyes, and capture this gripping phenomenon with your lens. This trek will not give you the pleasant of hiking up a mountain, but the view of fireflies along the route to the prabalmachi.It offers a breathtaking picturesque backdrop of both Prabalgad and Kalavantin Durg, with a scenic valley view of the outskirts of Panvel.Prabalmachi Event DetailsTrek Level:- MediumTime Require to Climb:- 2.5 hoursRegion:- PanvelEvent CostPer Person (Without Transportation) - description:
CHARDHAM YATHRA 2024

Trip Fee : INR 29,750/Person

Batch-1 : 09 June TO 17 June 2024

Batch-2 : 15 June To 23 June 2024

Duration: 09 Days & 08 Nights (Haridwar)3

Contact : 9686633699 / 7975054556


Overview 

=============

CHARDHAM YATRA refers to the four temples that are situated in the Garhwal region of Uttarakhand, India. They are YAMUNOTRI, GANGOTRI, KEDARNATH, BADRINATH. These temples have an architecture which is about 1000 years old. These temples are made of stone slabs and are a beauty and a sight to see. Surrounded by rhododendrons, the trek to these temples teaches us a lot about their history and the mythology and the significance behind them.


What you Expect from the Trek

=> Kedarnath Darshan

=> Badrinath Darshan

=> Yamunotri Darshan 

=> Gangothri Darshan 

=> Ganga Panch Prayags

=> Haridwar & Rishikesh 

=> Himalayan Ranges


Importance of CHARDHAM YATRA 


● Importance of YAMUNOTRI : Origin of River Yamuna, Temple of Goddess Yamuna is located here.

●Importance of GANGOTRI : Origin of River Ganga (Ganges), Temple of Goddes Ganga is located here.

● Importance of KEDARNATH : Shrine of Lord Shiva, One of the 12 Jyotirlingas, part of Panch Kedar.

● Importance of BADRINATH : Temple of Lord Vishnu, also known as Badri Vishal. Saint Adi Shankaracharya attained freedom from incarnation in this region



*Tentetive Schedule*p


Day 0 (JUNE 08 & JUNE 14): Bangalore/Chennai/ Hyderabad to Haridwar 


Get Flights Bangalore/Chennai//Hyderabad to Dehradun Airport then take cab to Haridwar 


Note : your flight tickets & cab arrangements Mad Adventurers Group will take care with extra cost (Cost not included)


DAY 1 (JUNE 09 25 & JUNE 15): HARIDWAR TO BARKOT HT : 1352 MTS. DISTANCE 210 KMS TIME 7-8 HRS


Take a trip via Mussoorie on the way to Barkot, stopping at Kempty Fall and Mussoorie Lake (Suggestible to have your lunch at Kempty fall as further no good restaurants are available before Badkot). When the time comes, make a beeline towards Barkot and check into your hotel. After the Pahad (hill) Yatra of Yamunotri is completed the following day, you have the remainder of the day to recharge. It's recommended that you spend the night at Barkot.



The weather in Barkot is mild all year round, with average highs of 25 degrees Celsius and lows of 10 degrees Celsius and five degrees Fahrenheit.



DAY 2 (JUNE 10 & JUNE 16) : BARKOT TO YAMUNOTRI TO BARKOT



DRIVE 36 KM WALKING TIME 6 KM (ONE SIDE)



As the sun rises, To reach Yamunotri, start your walk at Jankichatti/Phoolchatti (6kms). Traveling by foot, horseback, or a Doli, at one's own expense. The trail travels through a verdant valley populated by a wide variety of plant life, including conifers, rhododendrons, cactus, and other varieties of Himalayan plants. Respectfully, Yamunotri Wrapping rice in a towel and dipping it into the boiling water of the kund is a great way to prepare it. This rice called "Prasad," which pilgrims take home with them. Divya Shila may be worshipped here at this location, before continuing on to Jamunabai Kund for a refreshing dip and to get a glimpse of the holy Yamunaji. Get back on the road to Barkot for another night there. The 19th-century Yamunotri Temple was commissioned by Maharani Gularia of Jaipur. This century has seen two separate destructions and reconstructions of the structure. A common method of cooking rice in Yamunotri involves wrapping it in a towel and dipping it into the steaming water of the Tapt kund. This rice is known as "Prasad" and is given to pilgrims to take home with them. Nearby, devotees may do "Pooja" (worship) at the Divya Shila statue. Surya Kund, or the Sun's Pool, is a collection of pools fed by a series of hot springs located next to a temple. Of them, Surya Kund is the most important. The average high temperature in Yamunotri during the summer is 18 degrees and the average low is 10 degrees. Days are mild, but evenings may be frosty.



DAY 3 (JUNE 11 & JUNE 17 ) : : FROM BARKOT TO UTTARKASHI HT :1352 MTS. DISTANCE 100 KMS TIME 3-4 HRS



Get in the car and go to Uttarkashi after breakfast. Upon arriving at Uttarkashi, you may check into the hotel. Pay a visit to the Kashi Vishwanath Temple in Uttarkashi. Rest for the night at Uttarkashi.



One may visit many ashrams and temples in Uttarkashi. Its name, Kashi, comes from the fact that it is so similar to and located (as north of) the city of Kashi (Varanasi). A city on the banks of the Ganges, like Varanasi.



One of the earliest Shiva temples in Northern India is the Vishwanath temple. the Maharani Khaneti Devi of Tehri State rebuilt it in the original form in 1857. It occupies a prime location in the middle of town. From ancient times forward, worshippers have brought their offerings to the temple and laid them at the base of a gigantic iron trident that stands as a symbol of the heavenly mother. The temple grounds also have modest temples dedicated to the gods Ganeshji, Sakshi Gopal, and Markandeya Rishi. A unique aarti, known as Akhand Jyoti and Akhand Abhishek, are performed each morning and night. Uttarkashi is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas and is referred to as "Saumya Varanasi" in the Skanda Puran. The Shakti Temple is located just across from the Vishwanath Temple. It features a large "Trishul" that is roughly 6 metres tall and 90 centimetres in diameter at its base. There are varying theories concerning its composition, but the top half seems to be iron while the bottom half is copper. This Shakti was so named because, according to the epics, Goddess Durga (Shakti) threw it towards the demons. Over here, at this spot, stands this Shakti that was constructed after that. Conditions in Uttarkashi - Summers may be rather warm (between 30 and 35 degrees Celsius), but the cool evenings make up for it.



DAY 4 (JUNE 12 & JUNE 18) : UTTARKASHI TO GANGOTRI TO UTTARKASHI HT : 3048 MTS. DISTANCE 100 KMS TIME 3-4 HRS



Start your journey to Gangotri bright and early (with a breakfast in a backpack), stopping at Gangnani to bathe in the holy waters of Garam Kund, and then continuing on through the scenic Harsil Valley. Harsil is well-known for its stunning landscape, which includes many Deodar trees and towering mountains. Take a holy bath in the Ganges, or Bhagirathi as it is known at its source in Shree Gangotri. After finishing your Pooja and Darshan, take some time to unwind in the serene setting. Travel return to Uttarkashi at a later time. Rest for the night at Uttarkashi. Located on the right bank of the Bhagirathi River, the Gangotri Temple was built in the 18th century by the Gorkha General Amar Singh Thapa. The summertime high in Gangotri may reach 20 degrees Celsius. Even in the heat of summer, temperatures may drop to about 10 degrees Celsius at night. If you plan on going to Gangotri in the summer, bring some light woollen garments. Gangotri's winters are notoriously frigid. As winter approaches, Gangotri will be blanketed with snow. The severe snowfalls of winter force the closure of all pilgrim centres.



DAY 5 (JUNE 13 & JUNE 19 ) UTTARKASHI TO GUPTKASHI HT : 1319 MTS. DISTANCE 220 KMS TIME 8-9 HRS



Get in the car and go to Guptkashi via Moolgarh and Lambgoan in the morning after a hearty breakfast.


At Tilwara, along the way, you may see the picturesque Mandakini River. Kedarnath is the source of the Mandakini River, which you may follow all the way to Guptakashi, where you can then pay a visit to the Ardh Narishwar Temple. After arriving at Guptakashi, guests may check into the hotel.



Staying the night at Guptakashi. The term "Gupt Kashi" is an abbreviation for "Hidden Benares," which is the original meaning of the name. According to legend, when the Pandava brothers went in quest of Shiva, he hid in



Guptkashi at first, but then fled to Kedarnath, farther up the valley, to avoid being seen. Guptkashi In the summer, the weather is mild, with highs in the 25°C to 30°C range. Winters are really cold.





DAY 6 (JUNE 14 & JUNE 20 ) : GUPTKASHI TO KEDARNATH


DISTANCE 30KMS BY ROAD & 19KMS TREK


Leave for Kedarnath dham in the morning after breakfast. Enjoy the Kedarnath Darshan and return to your hotel. Staying the night at Kedarnath.


A driver will take you to the Helipad where you've made advance arrangements in the morning. Whether you're arriving by helicopter or hiking, just let Driver know when to expect you, and he'll be there to pick you up. A helicopter ride is not included of this deal. Our driver will leave you in Sonprayag in the morning so you may catch a local jeep to Gaurikund and begin your trek to Kedarnath Ji. The journey back to Sonpraag after darshan involves retracing your steps. There is a severe lack of parking, which means your driver may return to another palace if you are unable to reach him through his cellphone.


The Kedarnath range provides a stunning background for the Kedarnath shrine, one of Lord Shiva's 12 jyotirlingas. The Hindu deity Lord Shiva also goes by the name Kedar. Legend has it that after defeating the Kaurava in the Battle of Kurukshetra, the Pandavas felt terrible over killing their own brothers and sought Lord Shiva's blessings to atone for their sins. After many successful evasions, he finally found safety in Kedarnath, disguised as a bull. After realising he was being pursued, he dove below, leaving just his hump above ground. Because of its elevation, Kedarnath experiences chilly temperatures throughout the year. The summers are mild and pleasant, whereas the winters are harsh. The average high temperature throughout the summer months is approximately 20 °C. Wearing anything woven from a light woollen is suggested. Temperatures in Kedarnath may drop to below freezing during the winter months. At this time of year, snowfall is common. Tourism is low at this time of year because of the harsh weather.


DAY 7 (JUNE 15 & JUNE 21 ) : KEDARNATH TO GUPTKASHI 


DISTANCE 19 KMS DOWN TREK & 30KMS/1HR BY ROAD


Following morning Pooja and breakfast, guests at the Kedarnath hotel may check out and return to Sonprayag. Our driver will wait for you at the agreed-upon location. Get back in the car and go to the Guptkashi hotel for the night.


DAY 8 (JUNE 16 & JUNE 22) : GUPTKASHI TO BADRINATH HT : 3133 MTS. DISTANCE 215 KMS TIME 7 HRS


Get in the car and go to Badrinath after breakfast. At the time of your arrival in Badrinath, please check into the hotel. After taking a dip in the Taptkund, devotees are invited to stay for the evening's Badrivishal Darshan and Aarti. The Pinddan Shraddh of ancestors, or Brahamakapal, is a major reason for its significance (Pitrus). Mana, Vyas Gufa, Maatamoorti, Charanpaduka, Bhimkund, and the "Mukh" of the Saraswati River aren't the only fascinating tourist destinations in the area. Situated within a three-kilometer radius of Badrinathjee. Staying at Badrinath for the night. Mana Village is the final Indian settlement before reaching Tibet, and is inhabited by a mixed


DAY 09 (JUNE 17 & JUNE 23 ) : BADRINATH TO JOSHIMATH TO RUDRAPRAYAG TO Rishikesh 


Get picked up by a vehicle in the morning and taken to Rishikesh via Rudraprayag. Start Early morning from Rudraprayag to Rishikesh & get flight from Dehradun Airport to ur destination or you can extend your trip for exploring the Rishikesh

description: Behold the glimmering thrill of millions of fireflies through your naked eyes, and capture this gripping phenomenon with your lens. This trek will not only give you the ecstasy of hiking up a mountain, but it will also let you take capture images allowing you to re-live the magical experience all over again. The overnight trek takes place at Prabalmachi, a vast meadow, perched on Kalavantin Durg where you will be able to watch and capture gazillion fireflies. It offers a breathtaking picturesque backdrop of both Prabalgad and Kalavantin Durg, with a scenic valley view of the outskirts of Panvel. Chasing fireflies, with hills giving a fantastic context, is something that you can cherish forever. Prabalmachi is hallowed with cliffs, rock-strewn terrain, and meadows. Camping at Prabalmachi is an exciting and fun-filled experience overflowing with unique stories, unexploited nature, under a blanket of the star-studded sky and in the midst of a forest full of fireflies. Prabalmachi night trek difficulty level: MediumRegion Panvel near Shedung PhataTotal time required for climbing: Maximum 2.5 hrs from ThakurwadiDuration: 1 day and 1 nightPrabalmachi Fireflies Cost:Cost: Rs. 1599/- per person with transport (Panvel to Panvel)Cost Rs 1199/- per person without transportTrain TimingsFrom CSMT to Panvel14:34 CST14:52 Vadala Road15:03 Kurla15:23 Vashi15:32 Nerul15:54 PanvelFrom Thane to Panvel14:54 Thane15:11 Koparkhairne15:23 Nerul15:46 PanvelDay One -Saturday 16:00 Assemble outside of Panvel Railway Station near the ticket counter.16:15 Move towards base village Thakurwadi by private vehicle.17:00 Reach Thakurwadi and ascend to Prabalmachi village.Enjoy fireflies on the way.20:00 Reach Prabalgadmachi village.21:00 Dinner (Veg or Non-Veg).Day Two - Sunday05:30 Wake up and freshen up.06:00 Start ascending Kalavantin Durg.07:00 Reach on top and explore.08:00 Start descending to Prabalmachi.09:30 Reach Prabalmachi and have breakfast.10:30 Descend to Thakurwadi.12:00 Reach Thakurwadi and move toward Panvel by Bus or private vehicle.13:00 Reach Panvel railway station and disperse.  Kalavantin Trek is optional, if you don't want to do it, you relax at the campsite.For Kalavantin Trek proper trek shoes and a torch are compulsory. Otherwise will not allow doing trek.People may board the same train from their respective stations of convenience.Missing the train is missing Fireflies Night Trek to Prabalmachi, no refund will be provided. What is included in the tourTransportation from Panvel to Base village to Panvel by local vehicle (with transport option)1 Veg or Non-Veg Dinner and 1 veg BreakfastTent stay on sharing basisKalavantin Durg TrekBasic First AidGuide & Expertise chargesWhat is NOT included in the tourAny transportation (without transport option)Travel cost till Panvel and back (with transport option)Mineral water/lime water/ purchased for personal consumptionAll kinds of Extra Meals / soft drinks ordered.Any kind of personal expenses.Any kind of cost which is not mentioned in the cost included above.All expenses incurred due to unforeseen and unavoidable circumstances like roadblocks, and bad weather.Any medical / Emergency evacuations if required.Mask and Sanitizer2/3 liters of water.Trekking Shoes provide more grip and comfort on the trekSome Dry fruits / Dry Snacks / Energy Bars.Glucon D / ORS / Tang / Gatorade sachets.Good Torch must with an extra battery.Trekking Shoes provide more grip and comfort on the trek.Sleeping material. (Sleeping bag or 2 bedsheets).One Day Backpack 20 to 30 liters.Extra pair of clothes.Sun Cap and Sunscreen.Personal First aid and Personal Medicine.Identity Proof.

description: The Anthargange trek is one of the most sought after trek around Bangalore. It's the combination of trekking and cave exploration that drives the excitement factor. Anthargange hill is completely surrounded by boulders. Located around 65km from Bangalore near Kolar, this hill is at an altitude of1712m above sea level. Anthargange night trip is perfect for trekking and night cave exploration. Around 3km trek is pretty moderate as the journey beings by making your way through broken rocks and tricky path in the boulders to finally reaching the cave site to probe. This amazing experience of making your way through the formation and crawling at times because of the cave's volcanic rock formation is a tale worth sharing. The experience at Anthargange cave takes you back to the primeval times. And you finally get to be a "Cave Man". The effort pays off as the feeling of contentment starts settling in post the completion of the trek. Unwind by the bonfire and watch the night's magic captivate you, if luck favours, you might catch a glimpse of some wild animals around. As the dusk fades away, make your way back through the cave to the base.This adventure activity at Antargange is a must have experience around BangaloreItinerary11:00 PM Pick up starts from Bangalore04:00 AM Reach Anthargange base04:15 AM Start the small trek followed by cave exploration06:30 AM Wake up & watch sunrise07:00 AM Head back towards Anthargange base07:15 AM Head to the nearby restaurant07:45 AM Freshen up & have breakfast09:30 AM Head back to Bangalore11:00 AM Reach BangaloreInclusionsTransportation (from/to Bangalore)Sunrise Trek and Cave ExplorationGuideBreakfastThings to carryTorch per person.Sports shoes or trekking shoes in good conditionBackpackRain coat/PonchoWater bottlesEnergy bars, dry fruits, etc.Personal medicationSweater/ jackets for the night Toiletries (napkin, tissues, etc.)Flashlight/Torch with extra batteriesTrack pants and cotton TshirtCamera (optional)Pick up pointsRR Nagar (11:00 PM) - Gopalan Arcade, Mysore roadBanashankari (11:30 PM) - Bus StopBTM (11:50 PM) - Udupi Garden Bus Stop, Near A2BSilk Board (12:10 AM) - Prashant hotel (towards marathali road)Marathahalli (12:30 PM) - Opposite to KalamandirTin Factory (12:50 AM) - Bus StopDrop points are same as chosen pickup pointsMode Of Transport1 to 12 pax tempo traveller or winger ( 14 seat vehicle)12 to 30 pax mini Bus ( 24 seat or 32 seat vehicle )30 to 50 pax big bus ( 50 seater vehicle)Organiser DetailsFor queries about this event contact the organiser Manoj 9886421211.About Escape2ExploreEscape2Explore Adventures is not just one of Bangalore's leading adventure travel companies, it's a hub for all nature lovers, adventure enthusiasts and those who just need a little escape from the routine of life to explore outdoors. With Escape2Explore, find the much notable adventure activities near Bangalore. Choose from a wide range of exciting outdoor activities and destinations that best suit your team/group, and leave the arrangements to us.

description:
Hello travelers!
Nestled among the mountains of the western ghats, Wayanad is one of the loveliest hill stations of southern India. There are many good things about Wayanad like full of greenery, misty mountains, wildlife sanctuaries, lakes, dams, waterfalls, tea estates, coffee estates, historical caves, panoramic views, and top of it all – pleasant climate most of the year. With its rich flora and fauna, Wayanad is part of the Nilgiris Biosphere Reserve. Wayanad is actually a large district that has varying altitudes between 700 meters and 2100 meters above sea level, which will appear in its climate as you pass by.

description: Kalsubai Trek – the pride of Maharashtra standing at 5400 feet is the highest peak in Maharashtra! Nestled in the Sahyadri mountain range and Kalsubai Harishchandragad Wildlife Sanctuary Kalsubai Trek offers an enjoyable trekking experience for the trekkers. Also called the Maharashtra’s Everest the Kalsubai monsoon trek offers astounding views of famous peaks such as Alang Madan Kulang Ratangad trek and Ajoba. The trek starts through the extensive fields and farming land which then takes you through the ladder section after which you reach the summit where Kalsubai temple is located. The Kalsubai monsoon trek is a moderate grade trek and it is recommended to start a fitness routine and pace it up to build your endurance level. You can start with a small brisk level walk of 5 km and gradually increase the pace and perform the routine 4 times a week. You may also start doing planks squats and lunges for strength training. Consider performing some stretching exercises to promote relaxation in the tissues and enhance body flexibility.Kalsubai trek base village: BariKalsubai height: 5400 feet above sea levelKalsubai Trek distance: 6.6 kilometers one-way from the base villageKalsubai Trek duration: 3-5 hoursKalsubai trek difficulty level: EasyKalsubai distance from Mumbai: 155 kilometers by roadKalsubai distance from Pune: 175 kilometers by road.ItineraryDay 010:15 pm: Meet the Trikon Team at Bisleri Factory Andheri (E)10:30 pm: Depart for Kalsubai pickups on the way11:15 pm: Pick up from Pritam Hotel Dadar (E)12:00 am: Pick up from Teen Hath Naka Junction ThaneDay 103.00 am: Reach Kalsubai Base Village and rest for sometime05.00 am: Good morning freshen up and have breakfast05.30 am: Commencement of the Kalsubai trek after briefing and a short introduction09:00 am: Reach Kalsubai Top; Explore the summit and witness some of the other peaks from top10.00 am: Start descending01.00 pm: Reach base village freshen up and have lunch03.30 pm: Start return journey08.00 pm: Reach Mumbai (Depends upon the traffic) https://www.ttrikon.com/trip/kalsubai-monsoon-trek-from-mumbaiPlease call on +91 9819021806/9820022466 for any query. Join our whatsapp group https://chat.whatsapp.com/KFLuTuur1Cs6XlXmGHCbE7For Upcoming Event :  https://www.ttrikon.com/collections/upcoming-eventsRegardsTeam Trikon

description:
The highest Peak of Maharashtra, Kalsubai - get ready to experience one of the most amazing treks with temperature 10 to 20 degrees during winter.
Hurry up!!! Only 13 slots available on a first come first serve basis.
Difficulty level : Medium
Category: Adventure / Trek / Nature Camping
Weather Forecast: Weather near Kalsubai ( https://www.accuweather.com/en/in/igatpuri/189444/daily-weather-forecast/189444?day=50 )
Kalsubai :
The peak of Kalasubai in Nagar district is the highest peak of the mountain range of Sahyadri. The everest of the Sahyadris, Kalsubai trek is a dream of every avid trekker to climb it at least once. Kalsubai is a part of the Kalsubai Harishchandragad Wildlife Sanctuary which spreads from Kalasubai to Harischandragad in Akole. The Kalsubai sanctuary is a challenge to trekkers with its rugged hilly terrain and the Kalsubai pinnacle at its height of 5500 ft is a real steep climb.
https://a248.e.akamai.net/secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/4/a/c/event_140026252.jpeg
https://a248.e.akamai.net/secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/2/5/4/event_140025652.jpeg
According to the legend, Kalsu, a came to the Indore village at the foothills of Kalsubai. She took service with a Koli family on condition that she should not be asked to clean pots and sweep. Matters went smoothly till one day, when one of the family-members ordered Kalsu to clean some pots and clear away some litter. She did as she was told to, but immediately climbed the hill and stayed there till her death.
https://a248.e.akamai.net/secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/3/0/8/event_140025832.jpeg
There is a steep and difficult route from Indore but trekkers prefer the ladder-route from Bari village which is about ten kms from Bhandardara. It usually takes three hours to reach the top from Bari. Soon after leaving Bari, there is a Hanuman temple and the route from behind this temple takes the hiker straight to the summit. There are three iron ladders along this route. There is a well near the last iron ladder as one approaches the top but the water is not potable. At the summit is a small temple of Kalsubai, which can seat just three people.
At a height of 5500 feet Kalsubai offers a panoramic view. Towards west ,Alangad, Madangad & Kulanggad could be seen towards south is the famous Bhandardhara lake and Ratangad beyond it.
https://a248.e.akamai.net/secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/2/e/0/event_140025792.jpeg
Pics Courtesy: Ruben Fredrick
Tentative Itinerary:
Day 1:
Fri 13:15 pm : Board train to Kalyan
Day 2 :
Sat 06 AM : Reach Kalyan
Sat 07 AM : Head to base village ( Breakfast on our way )
Sat 10 AM : Reach Base Village ( lunch at base village)
Sat 6 PM : Reach peak
Day 3 :
Sun 5 AM: Wake up call and beautiful hike till sunrise.
Sun 7 AM: Trek back to base
Sun 11 AM : Start for Kalyan
Sun 3 PM: Board Konark express (11019) to Hyderabad
Day 4: Mon 4:00 AM : Reach Hyderabad and back to work!
IT IS NOT A LUXURY EVENT. NEED TO SETTLE WITH AVAILABLE LIMITED RESOURCES.

Kindly transfer to gpay/phonepay 8978709333 (Paytm to 8978087373)

[ Food in Train is excluded /GHAC refund rules apply]
Things to Bring:

Rucksack/ backpack.
Sleeping Bag.
Shoes with good grip & two pairs of socks
A few plastic covers to keep items dry.
Slippers/ floaters for using in night.
Torch.

First Aid kit, any specific medicines you need.

12.Carry Identification card.- (Preferably original AADHAR / Driving License)
Wind cheater (It'll get really cold on the top)
Dry fruits, Energy bars, Citrus fruits, salty food,
ORS packets

( http://files.meetup.com/1166925/GHAC%20Disclaimer%202012.pdf )

Responsible Trekking:
Most of us may not be serious trekkers but all of us have equal responsibility in protecting our beloved earth. GHAC earnestly requests all its members to be socially responsible whilst the treks and avoid any littering, shouting when in wild or causing anything that would disturb the normal ecology. Try to avoid plastics as much as possible.
Important Instructions - Please Read

No smoking and no alcohol, No littering, no pollution of water.
This is not a luxury trip, but utmost care has been taken to make your trip comfortable, enjoyable and memorable in a low budget.

description:
We would be visiting the following:
Oravakal Rock garden
Belum Caves
Gandikota- The Indian grand canyon
Note : Please read the whole page before RSVP.
The Indian Grand Canyon
Gandikota acquired its name from the picturesque gorge (called Gandi in Telugu) formed between the Erramalai hills, which are also called the Gandikota hills.
A deep valley and impassable hills with massive boulders of red granite, reminding one of the Grand Canyon, surround the fort, situated amid wild forests. The gorge formation is such that the Pennar river flows about 90 meters below on the western and northern sides and is said to have offered a strong natural defense to the Kakatiya, Vijayanagar and Qutub Shahi kings
Famous for their stalactite and stalagmite formations, Belum Caves, about 110 km from Kurnool town are the second longest natural caves in the country next only to Meghalaya caves.
When you drive into the entrance of the site that houses the caves, you might think you landed up in the wrong place. The vast expanse of flat land betrays the presence of these impressive caves right beneath you. When you climb down the first 20 meters, the magnificence of this natural wonder will blow you away. You get to walk around 1.5 kilometers of the well-lit caves and even dip your foot in the Patala Ganga (underground Ganges), a natural perennial stream that flows through the caves.
Orvakal Rock Garden
A miniature Grand Canyon of sorts, Oravakallu is an interesting landscape of majestic rock formations around a long winding
This natural architectural wonder makes for a great trek as you climb up the red rock formations of all shapes and sizes. After a tiring walk up to the highest point, you are rewarded with an amazing view of the water body set against the backdrop of gorgeous open spaces and clear blue skies.
The park has been a site for film production for famous movies like Baahubali: The Beginning (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baahubali:_The_Beginning)
Tentative Itinerary :
Day1 : Saturday Morning 5 am start to Gandikota by a private vehicle/self cars.
Pick up point to be decided later depending on members.
Reach Gandikota and explore around followed by night camping.

Followed by Belum caves. And drive back to hyd.

description:
Popularly known as Kashmir of Karnataka, a town situated just 40 kms from Goa, Karwar has it all, starting from exotic beaches to thrilling adventure sports!
This cinematic city harbors the river Kali , that makes it possible for all types of water hungry adventure activities. Kayaking, Canoeing, Rappelling, trekking, River Zip-lining etc , you name it, you get it!
And to make it more attractive a TV series named “Sarkaar ki Duniya” has been shot on an island here and the best part we take you there in that private Island! So what are you waiting for? Book with us and get on this Island!
ITINERARY

Breakfast and Settling in’
Followed by practical instructions on paddling and navigation of canoes and kayaks.

Followed by Tea.
Cleanup and change, followed by bonfire, Dinner & music
Retire for the night.

Trekking through the mangrove forests on the banks of river Kali to see the

Breakfast.

description: Skandagiri Sunrise Trek with Water ActivitiesSkandagiri, also historically known as Kalwarbetta or Kalavara Durga is a mountain fortress located around 70 km from Bangalore. This tiring yet rewarding trek takes you through a spectacular journey amidst the wilderness. Starting by 10 pm from Bangalore, reach the base point by midnight and hereby begin the night trek. The serene and sublime atmosphere around Skandagiri will definitely boost your adrenaline. This 8km trek can easily be completed within 4 to 5 hours of ascending and descending Tried and tested both by amateurs and professionals, this trek is a must for thrill seekers. The climb gets tedious as you reach the Papagni Temple, hereby offering treacherous terrains amongst the dense shrubs around. Thereafter the steep slopes may require tricky footwork till the summit. The ruined remains of Tipu Sultan's fort and an abandoned fort remain at the top of the hill. Skandagiri is famous for walking above the clouds, literally! As you reach the top, enjoy the bonfire on the starry night couched inside your sleeping bags. Wake up to experience the morning winds caressing you, as you open your eyes to get the most magnanimous sight of the sun rising above a bed of clouds, a sight so rare. The misty valley of Skandagiri is bound to leave an everlasting impression in your mind.Trek Difficulty: ModerateBest season: Nov to FebDistance from Bangalore: 70 kmTrek Distance: 8 kmTentative ItineraryDay 011:00 PM Pick-up starts from BangaloreDay 103:00 AM Reach Base (05kms trek one side)06:00 AM Reach peak and relax.06:15 AM Enjoy sunrise08:30 AM Descend to the base and head towards any nearby Restaurant10:30 AM Start water activities like Kayaking and Swimming11:45 AM Leave for Bangalore12:00 PM Reach BangaloreWhat's IncludedTransportation (from/to Bangalore)Sunrise TrekBreakfastGuideForest ChargesWater Activities like Kayaking and SwimmingWhat's ExcludedWater BottleSnacksAnything not mentioned in Inclusions.Things To CarryBackpackRaincoat/PonchoWater bottlesEnergy foodPersonal medicationSweater/ jackets for the nightExtra clothing (in case you plan to dive in the lake)Sports shoes or trekking shoes in good conditionFlashlight/Torch with extra batteriesTrack pants and cotton TshirtCamera (optional)NoteYour equipment & types of equipment distributed to be carried by self, like bags, sticks, etc.As you are exploring nature, don’t expect washrooms near hills. Washrooms are only available at hotels, campsites & homestays on a multi-sharing basis. (we reach the hotel/campsite for breakfast or lunch).Don’t expect electricity & luxury in the camping area.Organizer DetailsFor queries about this event contact the organiser Sonu 9886421211

description:
Register Here
CFC is a community of Freelancers, Entrepreneurs, Self-employed and Remote Workers co-working independently. Some of us are new, while others may have years of experience to share. We’re a friendly, welcoming Tribe.
Whether you’re a developer, a writer, a designer, a small business or doing something completely wacky, if you’re a freelancer and you want to meet like-minded people then you’re welcome to join us (Includes Both Tech & Non-Tech freelancers)

10:00 AM – 10:30 AM: Welcome Note & Introduction.
10:30 AM – 11:00 AM: "Why Branding is essential for freelancing" by Jaya Shakthi Kannan Founder of CDIX Innovations.
11:00 AM – 11:30 AM: "Marketing for freelancing" by Jaya Shakthi Kannan Founder of CDIX Innovations.
11.30 AM – 11:45 PM: Networking Tea!

Reserve Your Seat Now!

W4PQ+CH3 Regional Startup Hub, Mellur, Madurai, Tamil Nadu 625002.

Network with like-minded professionals

Networking
Social media visibilities

Limited seats available—Register ASAP to secure your spot!

description: Cedat Center, a dynamic community hub, is excited to announce the Synerz Meetup, an event designed to bring together Students, Entrepreneurs, and Educators. This unique gathering aims to unite individuals from diverse backgrounds to exchange ideas, gain new insights, and to build meaningful connections.At Synerz Meetup, participants are encouraged to step out of their comfort zones, share their experiences, and learn from one another. Whether you’re a student seeking guidance, an entrepreneur with ambitious goals, or an educator dedicated to empowering others, Synerz provides valuable opportunities for growth and success.1. Community Activities - Engage in our interactive activities designed around the community's educational initiatives to enhance your skills & knowledge2. Speakers & Panel Session - Gain insights from industry leaders and experts on a variety of topics relevant to Education, Employment & Entrepreneurship3. Networking Opportunities - Connect, Engage and Network with like-minded individuals who shares your passion and interests for mutual growthCedat Center is a dynamic community dedicated to supporting Students, Entrepreneurs & Educators at every stage of their journey toward success in Education, Employment & Entrepreneurship. We believe that everyone deserves the chance to Learn, Earn, and Create their own path in today’s competitive world, that's why we're dedicated to providing opportunities that can change their life.Join us for a fun and interactive event filled with speaker sessions, community activities, and networking opportunities.﻿Come, let's connect, network, and grow together at Synerz Meetup.

description:
Call/WhatsApp on 9029099709
SPITI
Spiti Opens on 10 June and if you want to full circle, Enter from Shimla and exit from Manali then you should go after 10 June.
Heaven for Riders, Photographers, Trekkers, Poets, Writers and many more, Spiti is one places that cannot be described in words. You have to visit this region to believe the beauty it can offer. A variety of Lakes, Monasteries, Glaciers and wildlife, it offers a perfect off city destination to search your soul.
Route
Day 0 Chandigarh (14 June Night we will start)
Day 1 Chitkkul (15-June)
Day 2 Nako (16-June)
Day 3 Tabo (17-June)
Day 4 & 5 Kaza (18-19 June)
Day 6 Chandrataal (20-June)
Day 7 Sissu & Manali (21June)
Day 8 Chandigarh (22 June we will reach Chandigarh)
Daywise Itinerary:
## Day 0
We will start in the evening(7 pm) from Chandigarh
Chandigarh To Chitkul (345 km)
We will meet at (TBD) and after a small introduction session, we will start our journey towards our first halt at Chitkul,
Shimla will be a tea break spot so that you don’t miss this charming city before we leave for our night halt spot.
## Day 1 Chitkul
Chitkul, the last village on the Indo-Tibetan border, offers adventure seekers a chance to explore the rugged terrain and cultural heritage of the Himalayas. Trek through alpine forests, camp under the stars, or embark on a mountain biking adventure. Discover the unique beauty and culture of this stunning destination in the Kinnaur region.
Reach Chitkul and stay in our riverside tents to see the real beauty of this gorgeous village. We will have a bonfire and a small party to celebrate our trip.
Highlights:
Chitkul lake
Trek(optional)
India’s last village
Bonefire near lake
Night Stay: Chitkul
Food: Dinner
The full itinerary is on the following link:
https://travelbuddiestalk.com/event/spiti-valley-magic-of-the-himalayas/
Call/WhatsApp on 9029099709
Follow us on Instagram: @boywithbucketlist1
Package
Package Details:
Cost: 27000 for Triple Occupancy & 29000 for double occupancy
Inclusions
#Travel in a Private vehicle
#Stay for 8D/7N in double occupancy
#Meals(Breakfast-Dinner)
#Route Planning
#Activities
#Local Guidance
#All inner permits
Exclusions
#flight Fare
#Insurance
#Service or repair of the vehicle
#Personal Expenses
#Lunch expenses
#Day 0 Dinner, Day 1 Breakfast and day 9 Lunch is not included.
#Charges occurred due to unforeseen circumstances (Additional Accommodation charges due to delay in the journey)
#Any medical expense during the journey
#Any personal orders at the hotel other than the mentioned food
#Entry charges in any of the monument
Who we are ?
Travel Buddies is a solo traveller's community with a concept of travelling with strangers and come back with friends. We started 3 years ago as a meetup group and grew continuously, currently we have 17000 members on FB group and 10000+ members on our multiple meetup groups and website members.
Why this trip?
After doing trips like Northern lights in Sweden & 2000 KM road trip in Iceland we were looking for a unique experience for our members so that is why we are going for this trip.
Q.Pictures from our last trips.
Link: Click me (https://www.facebook.com/groups/BuddiesTravel/photos/?filter=albums)
Contact Us
Email: info@travelbuddiestalk.com
Contact: http://www.travelbuddiestalk.com
Call/Whatsapp: 9029099709
Team
Travel Buddies Talk

This is an exclusive event, you will get access to the event only after approval. You will get an approval message one day before the event.
Register Here for free:- https://go.ayventures.in/dDuP75
𝐉𝐨𝐢𝐧 𝐀𝐘 𝐒𝐭𝐚𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐩 𝐂𝐨𝐦𝐦𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐲- https://chat.whatsapp.com/EukwFQ8E5PfDqDnfUVQ5Mg
💰 Get Equity & Debt Funding at No Upfront Fees-https://go.ayventures.in/h4vOM0
***
AY Startup Community organizes regular startup networking events all over India.
25+ Events | 5500+ Founder Community | 1000+ Attendees
______________________________________________________
WHO IS THIS EVENT FOR?
•Entrepreneurs / Business Persons / CXOs
•Presidents / Directors
•Mentors / Investors / Ecosystem Partners / Corporates
Connect with the right people in a short 2-hour event with no distractions and ample time to discuss startups and the joy of solving problems.
_______________________________________________________________
WHY YOU SHOULD ATTEND? WHAT DO YOU GET?
By joining this event, you can find a co-founder, get funding for your startup, get mentorship, find new clients and grow, get solutions to your problems, discuss new ideas/opportunities, expand your network and join the AY Startup Community post the event.
Building a startup is a very hard and daring thing. More so if you do it all alone. That is why AY Ventures and our community is here to help and support you. By attending this startup networking event, you will also enable AY Ventures event to be the biggest startup event in India and a great success for the startup community in India.
_______________________________________________________________
HOW IS THE EVENT STRUCTURED?
• Session 1 (Individual Introductions): Everyone gets a chance to introduce themselves and share what they are working on whilst they also get to know what everyone else is doing.
• Session 2 (Networking): The floor is open for networking. You get 2 full hours to talk with everyone, share ideas, exchange contacts and discuss your current obstacles or opportunities.
______________________________________________________
ABOUT AY VENTURES (44.7 Crores+ Raised)
AY Ventures helps founders & companies raise capital from angel investors, venture capitalists, and family offices. Our transparent process, no hidden terms & charges, and expert team make fundraising seamless.
We also provide a range of services to founders like-

Loans from banks, NBFCs and private investors
Venture Debt and Revenue Based Financing
Pitch Deck, Business Plans & Valuation
Incubation/Acceleration for early-stage startups
Govt. Grants & Startup India Seed Fund and much more.

▶ Get Funding at no upfront fees book a callback-
https://go.ayventures.in/h4vOM0
📞 Or call us directly at 080350 76077
______________________________________________________________
Join us right now to be a part of India’s most active and fastest growing Startup Community!
CONNECT WITH US:
Community & Social Media: https://linktr.ee/ayventures
Mail- events.ayventures@gmail.com
WhatsApp- https://wa.me/9315823093
_____________________________________________________________________
FAQs:
-Can i pitch my startup to Investors at the event?
No, our event is only a networking platform. You won’t be able to present your ppt or pitch deck, so please only prepare to give a verbal introduction. You can avail AY Venture’s expertise in fundraising by contacting us at 08035 076077
-Do Investors come to these events?
Generally, investors do not come to these events, some have attended our events in the past but we cannot guarantee investors’ presence at our events.
-When will I get the approval/rejection message?
You will receive a message with your registration status one day before the event.

description:
Funded Startups Conference - Hyderabad
Funded Startups Conference a premier event exclusively for investors and founders of funded startups . This dynamic meetup is designed to facilitate meaningful connections showcase innovative ventures and explore potential investment opportunities. The event is powered by Global Startups Club & in association with Mojo Capital.
Key highlights include:
Investor Networking: Connect with a curated group of investors actively seeking promising investment opportunities. Build relationships pitch your startup and forge partnerships that can fuel your growth.
Startup Showcasing: Present your funded startup to a captive audience of investors industry experts and fellow entrepreneurs. Gain exposure receive valuable feedback and attract potential investors to take your business to the next level.
Investment Insights: Learn from seasoned investors and industry leaders who will share valuable insights trends and strategies to help you navigate the funding landscape and maximize your investment potential.
Collaborative Environment: Engage in interactive sessions and discussions with fellow founders and investors fostering collaboration knowledge sharing and the exchange of best practices.

description: ICCI (Inventivepreneur Chamber of Commerce and Industries) is dedicated to fostering global economic partnerships and promoting international cooperation. We have observed with great interest the significant contribution that tourism makes to the economy of your esteemed country, and we believe there are valuable opportunities for collaboration between our nations. In this context, the ICCI is vision to launch ICCI’s Tourism 2024. This mission will serve as a platform for Tour operators, Travel agents, Wedding planners, businesses from film, media, entertainment industry, potential investors, airways, educational institutes, hotels, hospitality industry players, Indian - International government, business associations and promotion councils. The primary objective is to facilitate discussions, foster partnerships, and explore opportunities to accelerate sector focused economy for all the participant countries and their businesses.  Attraction for ICCI’s Global Tourism Mission Type of Tourism CoveredDomestic Tourism, International Tourism, Outbound Tourism, Business Tourism, Adventure Tourism, Wildlife Tourism, Medical Tourism, Wellness Tourism, Pilgrimage and Spiritual Tourism, Cultural Tourism, Culinary Tourism, Film Tourism, Educational Tourism, Cruise Tourism, Rural Tourism, Beach Tourism, Space Tourism, Heritage Tourism Highlights for Global Tourism Mission 2024?Reach a high-caliber audience: Connect with influential travel executives, government officials, investors, and thought leaders from across the globe.Brand visibility and lead generation: Gain significant exposure through branding opportunities, speaking engagements, and networking events.Thought leadership: Position your company as an industry pioneer by participating in panel discussions, workshops, and other knowledge-sharing initiatives.Networking opportunities: Build valuable relationships with potential partners, clients, and customers.Positive brand association: Align your brand with a forward-thinking event that champions sustainable and responsible tourism practices. During this extravaganza, Countries can join to address communities through:§ PresentationsEmbassy diplomats from participant countries will deliver presentations to participant communities. Participants will gain insights into the global market for travel – tourism – hospitality industry. Session will be an opportunity to strengthen trade relations. Presentations shall cover various aspects of global market, including market trends, investment opportunities, and regulatory considerations. Thought leaders will add their expertise on these subjects. § Product DisplayParticipating countries shall showcase their products and services. Attendees will visit expo zone to view diverse range of products and services. This exposure will be a potential platform for business collaborations and investments in existing businesses. New age businesses shall showcase their services, new technology, innovation, new launch. Raw stall size will be in between 3x3, 6x6, 9x9. § Panel Discussion Experts or representatives of different country businesses, diplomat, global business and industry leaders will showcase their vision on market trends and regulations. Attendees will receive insight on the latest market dynamics, legal requirements and industry-specific regulations. Panel discuss will be focused on “Vision of tourism sector for year 2024” and “Main factors to attract potential investment in Tourism Sector” and “What are new age solutions to upscale tourism sector” § B2B ExchangeDiscussions related to collaborative opportunities, market insights, and mutual interests. Participants will join in-depth conversations about potential joint ventures, business collaborations, and shared areas of interest. The B2B exchange will cover market analysis, partnership prospects, and strategies for expanding businesses through collaboration. § Investors MeetThis exclusive session will cover discussions related to investment opportunities, project development, acquisitions, and mergers. Participants will join conversations about attracting investments and expanding business operations. Investors meet will include discussions on investment prospects, project funding, merger and acquisition strategies. § Business AwardsProminent businesses, government agencies, state governments, departments will be awarded for their outstanding contribution to the society § Global PromotionMission will be promoted globally on different tools of media including digital social platforms to engage target oriented global business communities, electronic media through news and program slots, print and digital media through press release and coverage about mission, indoor and outdoor media to attract participants of ICCI’s Mission Tourism 2024 and souvenirs will be circulated among ICCI’s 10000 global members

description:
Category: Trekking
Location: Roha, Raigad
Duration: 1 Night & 1 Day
Difficulty: Medium

Event Fees: Rs. 1499/- Per Person
(IMP Note - According to your booking registration, seats will be allocated in the bus in order)

About Surgad :  Surgad Fort Trek is located in Ghera surgad village in Raigad district near Roha. It is strategically located in a spur, fragmented from the Sahyadri mountains of Maharashtra. The fort was built by the Shilahar kings and the Nizam of Ahmednagar looked after the fort later on. Chatrapati Shivaji Maharaj reconstructed and restored the fort. The fort was captured by Shankarji Narayan from the Siddhi of Janjira during the Rajaram regime.
Bajirao Peshwa captured the Surgad fort in the year 1733. The Peshwas used this fort as a prison for the captured prisoners.

About Avchitgad: Avchitgad is a fort located in the Sahyadri ranges of Maharashtra. The fort is situated near Roha in the Raigad district. At the base of this fort is a village called Medha. This fort is believed to be built by Shilahar kings and subsequently used by the Nizam of Ahmednagar. The great Maratha king Chhatrapati Shivaji is also believed to have reconstructed this fort. The work was carried out in a hurry and hence the name 'Avchitgad'. In the Third Anglo-Maratha War, this fort was won over by Colonel Brother from the Peshwas in the year 1818 along with other forts in the neighbouring region.

• Meeting Point : SGNP Main Gate Borivali.
• Meeting Time : 10.00 pm on Saturday, 29th June 2024.

Itinerary:-
Day 00 - 29th June 2024 (Saturday) 
• 10.00PM - Depart from Borivali by a Private bus.
Enroute Pickups - 
(Kandivali, Goregaon, Andheri, Bandra, Sion, Chembur, Vashi, Nerul,  Kalamboli McD.)

*Day 01st: 30th June 2024 Sunday*
• 06.00 AM - Reach Base Village and breakfast
• 07.00 AM - Introduction and Start trek.
• 08.30 AM - Summit Surgad and Explore fort.
• 10.30 AM - Start Descending to the base village.
• 12.00 PM - Have lunch On the way and Start journey towards Avchitgad 
• 02.00 PM - Reach Avchitgad Base village and start trek
• 03.00 PM – Reach Avchitgad top and explore the fort.
• 04.00 PM – Start descend towards the base village.
• 06.00 PM – Reach Base village and Start return journey towards Mumbai.
• 09.00 PM – Reach Mumbai (Approx)

INCLUSIONS - 
• Transportation from Mumbai To Mumbai (Non AC Bus).
• Tea & breakfast, Lunch
• Evening Refreshments
• Trekking with all safety measures.
• Adventure Insurance 
• First aid kit.
• Guide

EXCLUSIONS - 
• Mineral Water, Beverages
• Anything not mentioned in the above inclusion list.

THINGS TO CARRY : 
• Identity Proof (must)
• A bottle of water (At least 3 Liters)
• Some ready to eat food, Plum Cakes, Biscuits etc.
• Personal Care Medicine those which u require usually.
• A good trekking shoes, extra pair of socks.
• Extra pair of clothes, Sleeping Bag, Mat, Beddings, etc. 
• A haversack to put in all the things to be carried, so that one has ones hands free while trekking.
• Pleases do not carry sling bags or Jholas.
• Please avoid wearing Gold and other ornaments.

RULES & NOTES
• Smoking and drinking alcohol is strictly prohibited.
• Sleeveless, Low neck, Figure hugging, Shirts/Tops, Short Pants, Hot Pant not allowed.
• All our photo, walks are Eco-friendly, kindly take care of nature around us.
• Respect the heritage and culture. 
• Do not litter, participants are requested to carry - - the waste back to the city and dispose it off in dustbins.
• Trek Leader’s decision will be final and binding.
• Participation confirmation only via confirmed bank transfer (50% advance payment)
• ‘BHATKANTI’ Group reserves all the right to change/deviate/cancel the plans without prior notice.
• Telephonic confirmation is mandatory, if unable to contact send us a text message.
• Payment made is non-refundable and non-transferable.

description:
Kashmir & Ladakh with Taktok Festival: July 13th to 21st' 2024
OVERVIEW
Get a fascinating insight into the people, culture, cuisine, lifestyle, and topography of the Himalayan region of Kashmir and Ladakh in our “Kashmir and Ladakh Experience” tour. In Kashmir experience, Srinagar and the famed Dal and Nageen lake, take a shikara ride on the serene waters of the Dal lake and stay at a comfortable houseboat on the lake and visit one of the many beautiful gardens.The journey from Srinagar to Leh via Kargil is an experience in itself with the dramatic ever-changing landscape through the mountain passes of Zoji la and Futu la and the towns of Kargil, Sonamarg, Drass, Likir, and Lamayuru. In Ladakh visit cross the high mountain passes of Khardung La and Chang la and Baralacha la; sit by the serenity of crystal clear high mountain lake of Pangong Tso; feel the spirituality at centuries-old monasteries of Hemis, Tiksey and Alchi; drive through some of the most dramatic mountain landscape in the world passing through dry arid mountains of different hues of brown and grey shaped through centuries by wind and climate; visit Nubra Valley sand dunes for a ride on the double-humped camels and stay at some beautiful locations from lakeside tents to village home stays.
To make the tour more interesting we have coincided it with the Hemis festival. In the quaint Hemis Jangchub Choling Monastery, the colorful extravaganza of celebrating the birth of Lord Padmasambhava with dance, music, prayers, masked performances and a medley of colors will be seen.
Essential Info
Cost: Rs 37500/-
Country: India
Start: Srinagar
End: Leh
Start Date: 13th July’ 2024
End Date: 21st’ 2024
Duration: 9 Days
Group Size : Min 5 / Max 15
Theme: Culture, Adventure, Experience
Highlights
– Stay at a Houseboat on the Nageen/Dal Lake
– Beautiful high altitude drives
– Cross the high passes of Zoji La, Fotu La, Chang La and Khardung La
– Monastic tour around Leh
– Ride a double-humped camel in the sand dunes of Hunder in Nubra Valley
– Be amazed at the mesmerizing beauty of Pangong Lake
– Unique experience of watching the masked dance performances at the Taktok Festival
COST - Rs 37500/-
SEE TRIP DETAILS : https://exoticexpeditions.org/ladakhhemisfestivalgrouptrip/
SEE ALL UPCOMING TRIPS : https://exoticexpeditions.org/upcomingtrips/
CONTACT US:
Santosh Nair
Call / Whatsapp : 9986450370
Email : contact@exoticexpeditions.org

description:
Ladakh – A land of magic and myths...bounded by the icy heights of the Karakoram and Himalayan ranges... beneath a carpet of rich hues of turquoise blue skies, lies the "Lost Kingdom" of Ladakh. Part fantasy, part reality, Ladakh is where the forces of nature have conspired over millennia to render a majestically unrealistic landscape.
This June, Team TheBrownTicket invites travel enthusiasts & culture/heritage lovers for an expedition to some spectacular landscapes and revel in some rare experiences of Ladakh. Experience the mystique and heart-thumping energy of "chhams" or dances performed by monks wearing colourful masks and brocade costumes to the accompaniment of cymbals, drums and long horns during the annual Hemis Monastery Festival, at the biggest & holiest Buddhist monasteries of the world! Take a stroll along the shores of the expansive Tsomoriri (Lake) whose waters change colour by the hour, making you feel it’s an artist at work who continuously paints new shades into the lake waters! Or be awe-struck by the confluence of lakhs of stars in the Milky Way from the high ranges of Ladhak. And sip Ladakhi tea as you indulge in some Yak wool weaving with master craftspersons!
Come, discover and live another life which shall leave you craving for more! An experience which we refer to as “Life mein ek baar banta hai”….A must do once in a lifetime...because as they say, the land of the Lamas has something to offer for everyone!!!
DATES: 14 to 23 June, 2024

description:
Call/WhatsApp at 9052220466 for a detailed itinerary/booking
For more info: https://unusualescapes.com/wonders-of-ladakh
***
Flanked by the Karakoram mountains on the north-east and the great Himalayan ranges in the south and cut through by the river Indus, Ladakh is one of the highest inhabited places on Earth. Ladakh is known for its magnificent landscapes, snow-capped mountains, color-changing lakes, deep lush valleys, Buddhist monasteries, the people, festivals, and rituals. Get set to visit one of the most beautiful places on earth! Leave all your tensions and worries behind, come and have an experience of a lifetime.
ITINERARY
DAY 01 | ARRIVE IN SRINAGAR
Arrive in Srinagar and start our journey to Kargil passing through Sonamarg, Zojila Pass and Drass Memorial. (Dinner Included)
DAY 02 | KARGIL - LAMAYURU - LEH
We will set out for Leh en-route stopping at Mulbek Monastery, Lamayuru Monastery, Sangam, Magnetic Hill, and Gurudwara Pathar Sahib. We reach Leh by late evening. (Breakfast Included)
DAY 03 | LEH SIGHTSEEING
Today is the day for exploring Leh. We visit several places including Hall of Fame, Leh Palace and Shanti Stupa.
DAY 04 | NUBRA VALLEY VIA KHARDUNG LA PASS
Drive to Nubra Valley via Khardung La Pass, the Highest Motorable Road in the World at 18,390 feet. Visit Diskit Monastery & witness the goofy looking Double Humped Bactrian Camel in Nubra.
DAY 05 | TURTUK + THANG, THE LAST INDIAN VILLAGE
Take a trip to the northernmost village of India. Thang lies on the Line of Control that divides India and Pakistan and offers spectacular views of the majestic mountains. You can even see the fence, army bunkers of both the sides, Indian and Pakistani flags from here. We also explore Turtuk village part of Shyok valley which is a breath of fresh air in the form of green pastures in an otherwise barren landscape.
DAY 06 | PANGONG LAKE VIA SHYOK
Today, head to Pangong Tso, the famous lake that appeared in the Bollywood movie 3 idiots. The beauty of Pangong Lake is just unimaginable and you would want to capture it into your cameras, and eyes from every angle.
DAY 07 | PANGONG LAKE - LEH
Return to Leh en-route visit Thiksey Monastery and 3 Idiots famous Rancho School
DAY 08 | DEPART
Head back home with a bagful of sweet memories!!!
TRIP DATES:
Start Date: June 29, 2024 (Saturday)
End Date: July 6, 2024 (Saturday)
Pick-up at Sheikh–Ul–Aalam International Airport, Srinagar/Drop at Kushok Bakula Rimpochee Airport.

Part fantasy, part reality, Ladakh is where the forces of nature have conspired over millennia to render a majestically unrealistic landscape.
This June, Team TheBrownTicket invites travel enthusiasts & culture/heritage lovers for an expedition to some spectacular landscapes and revel in some rare experiences of Ladakh. Experience the mystique and heart-thumping energy of "chhams" or dances performed by monks wearing colourful masks and brocade costumes to the accompaniment of cymbals, drums and long horns during the annual Hemis Monastery Festival, at the biggest & holiest Buddhist monasteries of the world! Take a stroll along the shores of the expansive Tsomoriri (Lake) whose waters change colour by the hour, making you feel it’s an artist at work who continuously paints new shades into the lake waters! Or be awe-struck by the confluence of lakhs of stars in the Milky Way from the high ranges of Ladhak. And sip Ladakhi tea as you indulge in some Yak wool weaving with master craftspersons!
Come, discover and live another life which shall leave you craving for more! An experience which we refer to as “Life mein ek baar banta hai”….A must do once in a lifetime...because as they say, the land of the Lamas has something to offer for everyone!!!
DATES: 14 to 23 June, 2024
SOUNDS INTERESTING...ISNT IT!
GET ALL DETAILS, BUZZ +91. 9810011955/+91 9871181775
OR
DROP US A LINE ON teamthebrownticket@gmail.com

description: Oktoberfest Delhi is a fun-filled festival featuring the finest international and homegrown beer brands, delectable restaurant pop-ups, incredible musical performances and much more. This vibrant event encapsulates the spirit of the original Oktoberfest held in Munich, Germany, by featuring an array of German beers, traditional Bavarian foods like pretzels, sausages, and schnitzels, and a variety of music and dance performances. Featuring the best of what there is to offer for beer & music lovers, lots of grub and unfiltered fun in this one of its kind experience with the sounds of oompah bands, the clinking of beer steins, and the laughter and chatter of people enjoying the festivities. Whether you're a beer aficionado, a food enthusiast, or someone looking to experience a piece of German tradition, Oktoberfest Delhi promises an unforgettable experience. Join us as we #RaiseATOAST to the country's rising beer & music scene through a two-days celebration replete with food for every palate, music for all ears and tipples for every beer aficionado. Trust us, you dont want to sit this one out.For inquires stall bookings contact 9911560440

description: Crafting Creativity: Pottery WorkshopUnleash your creativity and dive into the world of pottery at our special workshop! Join us for an immersive experience where you'll learn the traditional art of pottery including the mesmerizing technique of pottery on the wheel.Date: 30th June 2024Time: 6:30 AM - 10:30 AMLocation: Sarkhej AhmedabadWhat to Expect:1. Explore the rich history and cultural significance of pottery.2. Receive hands-on guidance from skilled artisans as you learn traditional pottery techniques.3. Craft your very own pottery masterpiece to cherish and display proudly in your homeWorkshop Details:1. Suitable for all skill levels from beginners to experienced enthusiasts.2. Limited spots available so be sure to reserve your spot early.3. Please note that only one piece is allowed to be made per person.Things to Carry:1. Water bottle2. Napkin or rough cloth for wiping hands and surfaces.3. Notebook and pencil/pen to jot down artistic ideas and inspiration.Ticket Information:General Admission: 600 INR per person.        Location:The exact location of the workshop close to the Sanand circle in Ahmedabad will be provided to participants upon booking tickets.Contact Information:For inquiries please reach out to:Chirag Pandya: +91 8128106354 / Jainal Kuvadia: +91 9930846331 Join the Maaie Artistry Community!Maaie a collaborative project of Akshat Drama Group & Arch and Curve Design Studio invites you to embark on a dynamic and inclusive artistic journey. Our tagline "Discover Create Inspire" encapsulates the essence of Maaie India fostering a sense of exploration and imagination within our creative community.Let's come together to explore the art of pottery ignite our creative sparks and inspire one another to new heights of artistic expression!

description: KHELGHARKhel Ghar is a workshop exploring Imagination and Storytelling through theatre exercises materials and found objects. The workshop would be a culmination of Combining Ideas Creating magical Stories Basic understanding of Playing Emotions Playing with ordinary objects and materials and actually playing fun theatre games :)Workshop Dates: 16 & 17 June 2024 (2 Days)Time: 9:00 am to 11:30 amAge Group: 5 to 12 YearsKEY TAKEAWAYS-Ignite imagination and Storytelling-Broaden perspective on everyday objects and materials-Enhance ways of expression-Creative thinking-Teamwork-Process workLanguage: Hindi Gujarati English depending on the group.About Mentor:Teertha is a theatre practitioner and a freelance artist. Her onstage presence is lively and wholly dedicated to the character she portrays. But with her background in design and her keen curiosity she's passionate about the research management and production process of the play as well.Her collaborations and experience with prominent theatre foundations around the country have introduced her to a range of regional art forms. Besides theatre she is interested in working with children; in bringing young minds into the magical world of art. Her approach to sustainability is transparent; and inspirational throughout all her projects.For more information: 9408029596

description: Join us in the introduction to the Tie and Dye technique. The art of folding tying and dyeing the fabric to get preconceived colourful patterns. Time: 11 am to 1 pmVenue: The Design Studio PrahladnagarFor Queries whatsapp/call- Garvi: 9427564757/ Nishra: 9106881798Material Kit Included.About the Workshop: •	Tracing the history of tie and dye.•	Learn the amazing tie-dye process from scratch.•	Learn different pattern making techniques; binding folding twisting and compressing.Takeaways:The chance to create and take home your own Shibori dyed Muslin Silk Stole.Craft India Collaborative and Knot Unknot invites all art enthusiasts to indulge into the art of Tie and Dye!By the end of the workshop you'll leave with a deeper understanding of Tie& Dye techniques and the confidence to continue exploring this captivating craft on your own. Whether you're a complete beginner or looking to refine your skills this workshop is perfect for anyone eager to unleash their creativity. Join us and discover the joy of creating beautiful patterns with just a simple fold and thread!

description: Welcome to From Clay to Spirit: Art Ritual TherapyThis therapy session is invite only as we can accommodate up to 8 participants.Please call Garvi- 7990965992 / Hemang- 9328809428 to book your seat.Date: June 15 2024 SaturdayTime: 08:00 PM onwardsVenue: The Design Studio Dev Atelier 100ft Anandnagar Road Prahladnagar AhmedabadCategory: Art TherapyEnergy Exchange: 777/-Craft India Collaborative presents a unique Art ritual blending the therapeutic power of art with the tactile nature of clay. Join us for an immersive art therapy experience guided by craft designer Garvi Kotak and Pranic Healer & art therapist Hemang Singh.Open to all those seeking mindful engagement and deep healing through clay therapy.Explore healing through a series of guided exercises. Participants will journey through the various phases of life from birth to death symbolically represented by molding and shaping clay. As you engage with the clay you will tap into your intuition reconnect with your inner child and embrace our naturally playful and curious selves.Throughout the session you will be gently guided to explore your emotions memories and aspirations allowing the clay to serve as a conduit for self-expression and introspection.At the heart of this experience lies the profound realization of our interconnectedness with the Earth and the universe. As you shape the clay we honor the cycle of life acknowledging both its beauty and its impermanence. Through this act of creation you will find solace and empowerment in shaping your own journey.As the workshop draws to a close we'll come together to reflect on our creations sharing insights and experiences in a supportive and nurturing environment. Complete with the cycle of transformation evolution and renewal.Embark on a journey of self-discovery through the soothing art of clay manipulation.Unlock the potential within you!From Clay to Spirit: Art Ritual Therapy.Seize this chance to mould your reality!Craft India Collaborative - Crafting connections one masterpiece at a time.
location: The Design Studio, B-926 Dev Atelier, 100ft Anandnagar Road, Satellite, opposite Reliance Digital, Prahlad Nagar, Ahmedabad, Gujarat 380015, India
title: Art Ritual Therapy: From Clay to Spirit
short_description: Experience "From Clay to Spirit: Art Ritual Therapy"

description: Social Dancing Nights nights draw people from diverse backgrounds, creating a welcoming and inclusive environment that encourages a sense of community and cultural exchange.Latin Twist Social events offer a chance for dancers to connect with seasoned professionals, allowing them to explore into the captivating world of Latin dance styles such as Salsa, Bachata, and the mesmerising African dance from Angola known as Kizomba.Hosted by Latin Twist - Mary Lobo & Caesar Lobo (DJ Cza)Date: Wednesday, June 26th, starting from 8:00 PM onwardsMusic: Salsa - Bachata - KizombaEvent Schedule:8:30 PM - 9:30 PM : Pre-Party Bachata Workshop, suitable for all skill levels!9:30 PM - 1:00 AM : After workshop, join us for Social Dancing in Salsa, Bachata, and Kizomba.Tickets for Social Dancing are available at the venue.Entry: 500 INR Cover Per Person. Excludes Workshop!------------More Info: Get in touch with Latin Twist at 9820847636 or check out www.latintwist.in.📸 Follow us on Instagram @latin_twistAbout Mary Lobo:Mary, an avid dancer hailing from Mumbai, embarked on her dance journey in 2007. For more than a decade, she has been spearheading Latin Nights every Wednesday in Mumbai.From the renowned Salsa Nights at Shiro Mumbai to the Fun Republic Social in Andheri, Mary's passion has now found a new home at AntiSOCIAL Mumbai. Mary's prowess on the dance floor spans Salsa, Bachata, Kizomba, and numerous other styles, with her dance adventures taking her across the globe, from Angola to Puerto Rico, from Miami to Moscow.She has graced the stage at various Dance Festivals, sharing her expertise and spreading her philosophy that dancing begins with the desire to move.Come join us and let the rhythm guide your steps!
location: VenueantiSOCIAL, Lower ParelCS #242, Near Viva Centre, Mathuradas Mill Compund, Lower Parel West, Mumbai
title: Latin Twist Socials Wednesday Night at AntiSOCIAL MumbaiLatin Twist Socials Wednesday Night at AntiSOCIAL Mumbai
dateandtime: June 26 | 8PM - June 27 | 1AMantiSOCIAL, Lower Parel, Mumbai
short_description: Join Latin Twist for Social Dancing Nights featuring Salsa, Bachata, and Kizomba.

description:
🎪 Heart of Fools: A workshop introducing Clowning for Well-being 🎭
Calling All Inner Stars and Silly Souls!
Get ready to unleash your inner performer and discover the joy of play! We're hosting a fun-filled gathering where you'll explore the basics of theatre and clowning with interactive games and exercises.
No experience necessary! Just bring your playful spirit and a willingness to laugh (at yourself and others, of course!).
What to expect:
Theatre warm-up exercises to break the ice and build confidence.
Introduction to clowning principles
Embrace the silliness and discover the power of play in a supportive space where you can unleash your inner clown.
Whether you're a seasoned performer or a complete beginner, this gathering is for YOU!
Details:
🗓🕛Date:8 June 2024 (9am to 11am)
📍 Venue: Cubbon Park, Kasturba Rd, behind High Court of Karnataka, Ambedkar Veedhi, Sampangi Rama Nagara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001
🔹 Audience: Open to all. No prior experience required
🔹 Hosted By: Shivam Vig in partnership with Dr. Parrots
🔹 Age Limit: 16+
🔹 Ticket Price: INR 199
🔹What to bring: A comfortable outfit you can move in (and maybe a red nose, if you have one!)
RSVP:
To Register, please make the payment of Rs.199 to 9545453067 through UPI.
For any queries please feel free to whatsapp us at 9545453067
Get ready to unleash your inner goofball and discover the magic of theatre and clowning!
🎟 Tickets: Few spots only. Book today for an unforgettable experience full of laughter and games!I

description:
A woman, two hours post-delivery, is still vulnerable and can sink into an emergency condition. As a caregiver, you must remember that her life is in YOUR hands. You must update your Resuscitation Skills!

Fernandez Hospital invites all obstetric care providers, doctors, nurses and midwives to a Hands-on workshop on Obstetric Emergencies and Life Saving Skills. The workshop comprises interactive sessions to make it an interesting and enjoyable learning time.

𝐂𝐨𝐮𝐫𝐬𝐞 𝐇𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭𝐬
𝑆𝑇𝐴𝑇𝐼𝑂𝑁 𝐼: 𝐵𝐴𝑆𝐼𝐶 𝐴𝑁𝐷 𝐴𝐷𝑉𝐴𝑁𝐶𝐸𝐷 𝐿𝐼𝐹𝐸 𝑆𝑈𝑃𝑃𝑂𝑅𝑇
Substation: Airway, Breathing – Mannequins
Substation: Hands-on BLS/CPCR/Arrhythmia Recognition and Defibrillation
𝑆𝑇𝐴𝑇𝐼𝑂𝑁 𝐼𝐼: 𝑃𝑃𝐻 𝐴𝑁𝐷 𝑆𝐻𝑂𝐶𝐾 
Substation: Fluid Resuscitation/Blood Component Therapy
Substation: Medical and Surgical Methods of Hemostasis in PPH 
𝑆𝑇𝐴𝑇𝐼𝑂𝑁 𝐼𝐼𝐼: 𝑆𝐻𝑂𝑈𝐿𝐷𝐸𝑅 𝐷𝑌𝑆𝑇𝑂𝐶𝐼𝐴
Hands-on Drill using the PROMPT Birthing Simulator for Shoulder Dystocia
𝑆𝑇𝐴𝑇𝐼𝑂𝑁 𝐼𝑉:  𝐸𝐶𝐿𝐴𝑀𝑃𝑆𝐼𝐴
Case Scenarios and Team-based Eclampsia Drill, Concept of Eclampsia Tray
𝑆𝑇𝐴𝑇𝐼𝑂𝑁 𝑉: 𝑁𝐸𝑂𝑁𝐴𝑇𝐴𝐿 𝑅𝐸𝑆𝑈𝑆𝐶𝐼𝑇𝐴𝑇𝐼𝑂𝑁
Initial Assessment of Newborn, Steps of Resuscitation, NRP Guidelines

𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐞𝐰 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐏𝐫𝐨𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐦𝐦𝐞
•	Pre-test and Post-test
•	An introductory 10 minute session for each workstation
•	Hands-on experience on mannequins at each station
•	Case Scenario to emphasize the ideal resuscitation protocol 
•	Question Time / Certificates

𝐑𝐞𝐠𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐅𝐞𝐞𝐬
• PG Students: 2500 Rs 
• Registrars: 4000 Rs
• Consultants: 4500 Rs
• Midwives: 1000 Rs
• Nurses: 700 Rs

𝑳𝒊𝒎𝒊𝒕𝒆𝒅 𝒕𝒐 𝑭𝑰𝑹𝑺𝑻 50 𝒑𝒂𝒓𝒕𝒊𝒄𝒊𝒑𝒂𝒏𝒕𝒔 𝒐𝒏𝒍𝒚 𝒊𝒏 𝑷𝑯𝒀𝑺𝑰𝑪𝑨𝑳
